content.description: A very easy route with an opportunity for some stemming up the second half. Typical Camelback choss, with pebbles aplenty. Just like all other routes, expect mostly feet with moderate hands. Still very easy climbing.Â
content.protection: 3 bolt face to 2 bomber rap 'I' bolts.
content.location:
Follow approach to Bobby's rock, on the east side there is an easy walk up approach that you would also take to set up top ropes for both The Flute and and Fry Babies. On this large area look to the top of the formation in the middle of the giant area your standing on, and follow bolts starting on the far (climbers) left and up through a chimney that begins on top half of the route. 

 #45 on the Marty Map

content.description: This route is the bolted face between The Flute and Crumble City. Easy to top rope by walking around to the right.

This is the rightmost route on the south face of Bobbie's Rock. Climb a featured face past three bolts to a tree belay.  

  Easy to top rope, but the two trees are about ten meters back from the edge. 

  There is a report of a beehive just right of the route at the base. Bee careful!

First few move are the hard part on the route but the holds are solid, also the last section is a little blank. Top 2/3s are where this route gets it's name, it get kinda flakey and a lot of loose sediment still climbable!
content.protection: Two bolts at the top accessible by walking up east side or climbing one of the bolted sport routes to the right.
content.location: Far left on the South facing wall before the overhang really starts.

content.description: Has several bolted lead routes that are short and bolts are pretty far spaced. Also has the ability to set up TR. Climbing is on the south exposure and routes are walk off. The sandstone is really flakey in some sections and breaks apart easily.
